treated_condition: High blood pressure, reduces stroke risk in patients with enlarged heart, treats kidney problems in type 2 diabetes
symptoms: Often none, may include headache, dizziness, fatigue if BP is high
side_effects: Body aches or pain, chills, cough, ear congestion, fever, headache, loss of voice, sneezing, sore throat, stuffy or runny nose, trouble breathing, unusual tiredness or weakness
precaution: Pregnancy can harm fetus, use birth control, monitor kidney function and potassium levels, use caution with liver/kidney disease, electrolyte imbalance, heart failure, avoid potassium supplements and alcohol, be careful with dizziness/fainting, check with doctor for all drug interactions and if severe vomiting/diarrhea occurs

treated_condition: High cholesterol, high triglycerides, prevention of heart attacks and strokes
symptoms: Usually no clear symptoms, sometimes chest pain, fatigue, or xanthomas (rare)
side_effects: Serious (Incidence not known): Severe abdominal pain, black/tarry stools, dark urine, dizziness, fever, headache, pale stools, loss of appetite, muscle pain/cramps/stiffness/weakness, muscular tenderness/wasting, nausea/vomiting, rash, unpleasant breath odor, unusual tiredness/weakness, vomiting blood, yellow eyes/skin (liver damage or rhabdomyolysis), More common: Flushing (warmth/redness of face, neck, arms, chest), Less common: Back pain, diarrhea, itchy skin
precaution: Pregnancy risk, avoid breastfeeding, high risk of muscle injury and liver damage, especially with high doses or interacting drugs, avoid grapefruit juice, alcohol, hot beverages, and spicy foods near dosing (to reduce flushing), monitor liver enzymes and kidney function, caution with diabetes (may raise blood sugar), stop before major surgery or if severe muscle pain, dark urine, or jaundice appears

caused_by: Bacterial infection (including Mycobacterium avium complex in HIV)
treated_condition: Bacterial infections in various body parts, prevention of MAC in HIV patients
symptoms: Fever, chills, fatigue, localized pain or inflammation depending on the infection site
side_effects: More common: Pain, redness, swelling at injection site, Less common: Difficulty breathing, loose stools, chest tightness, Rare: Severe abdominal cramps, watery/bloody diarrhea, fever, joint pain, swelling of face/mouth/hands/feet, severe rash, Incidence not known: Black/tarry stools, bleeding gums, blistering skin, chest pain, fainting, irregular heartbeat, yellow eyes/skin (liver damage), nausea, vomiting, muscle pain, dizziness, unusual tiredness, swelling of legs, sores in mouth, hearing loss
precaution: Serious allergic reactions including anaphylaxis, risk of liver problems (yellow eyes/skin, dark urine), may worsen heart rhythm issues (QT prolongation), caution with low potassium/magnesium, myasthenia gravis, kidney/liver disease, may cause severe diarrhea even 2 months after use, avoid antidiarrheal self-medication, monitor injection site for swelling/redness, use under direct medical supervision

caused_by: Diabetes mellitus (high blood sugar due to lack of insulin or insulin resistance)
treated_condition: Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes, lowers and controls blood sugar
symptoms: High blood sugar: thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, Low blood sugar: shakiness, sweating, confusion
side_effects: More common: Anxiety, blurred vision, chills, cold sweats, confusion, dizziness, fast heartbeat, headache, hunger, nausea, nightmares, seizures, shakiness, slurred speech, unusual tiredness, Less common: Swelling of face/arms/hands/legs/feet, rapid weight gain, tingling in hands/feet, Incidence not known: Fainting, hives, irregular heartbeat, loss of appetite, muscle cramps, swelling around eyes/face/lips/tongue, vomiting, Local: Redness, pain, itching, or swelling at injection site
precaution: Monitor closely for low and high blood sugar, rotate injection sites, carry quick sugar for emergencies, avoid alcohol (can worsen low sugar), monitor for weight gain, swelling, or shortness of breath, use caution with kidney/heart issues, store insulin properly, wear medical ID for diabetes, family should know emergency steps for severe hypoglycemia

treated_condition: Relief of mild to moderate pain
side_effects: More common: Drowsiness, relaxed/calm feeling, Incidence not known (serious): Agitation, bloating, blurred vision, chills, cold clammy skin, confusion, constipation, cough, dark urine, diarrhea, difficulty breathing/swallowing, dizziness, fainting, irregular or slow heartbeat, fever, hives/itching/rash, loss of appetite, nausea/vomiting, pale or blue lips/fingernails/skin, puffiness/swelling of face/lips/tongue/eyelids, shivering, sweating, tremors, unconsciousness, unusual tiredness or weakness, yellow eyes/skin, Overdose symptoms: Extreme sleepiness, pinpoint pupils, slow/irregular breathing, blue lips/skin, chest pain, cold/clammy skin, coughing with pink frothy sputum
precaution: Key precautions: Risk of addiction, dependence, and overdose, do not use in children <12 or post-tonsil/adenoid surgery (12Â–18) due to severe respiratory risk, avoid with alcohol and other CNS depressants, caution in elderly and patients with liver/kidney/lung disease, hypothyroidism, adrenal issues, mental health history, risk of respiratory depression, constipation, serotonin syndrome, and adrenal insufficiency, may cause neonatal withdrawal if used in pregnancy, breastfeeding mothers who are ultra?rapid metabolizers of codeine risk infant overdose, store securely and follow Opioid REMS program
